alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 29 at 2:08AM PST until November 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...MAJOR WINTER STORM STARTING TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 10 inches. Some of the higher benches and elevations could see 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Pangborn Airport, Cashmere, Badger Mountain Road, Okanogan, Nespelem, Wenatchee, Waterville, Entiat, Brewster, Omak, Oroville, Bridgeport, Disautel Pass, Mansfield, and Chelan. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes will be impacted.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
